content1.text: If you’re bored on the weekend, you should try Friday Night Funkin’ and have a blast as you dance and rap your way into The Girlfriend’s heart. You’ll have to rap and sing your way past Daddy dearest if you want to convince her to get down from the beatbox and join you for a romantic duo on the dancefloor.

She’s got her eye on you, too, as she shares tips and tricks in the tutorial to help you win The Father’s favor. Look, The Mother doesn’t look any less sinister, so don’t expect any free brownie points there either.

Friday Night Funkin’ from Ninjamuffin99 is a cartoon-style rhythm game with tunes from Kawai Sprite for its soundtrack, and PhantomArcade and evilsk8r are responsible for the fun graphics and animations. You can download the Friday Night Funkin’ game for Mac or Windows and play it free and safely on PC or mobile.

Try not to miss a note during a high combo, as you’ll have The Girlfriend in tears on the boombox. She’s terrified of thunder, but soothing her with some Cherry Dr. Pepper will score you some points as it’s her favorite drink.

The game is all about practicing as you work your way through the various weeks. Each week introduces new features, singing challenges against The Father, and characters that’ll either help you or block you from getting the girl.
Are there any tips for getting better in Friday Night Funkin’?
Practice makes perfect guys and gals. But let’s see what else you can do to find the courage and beat The Father at his rock and roll song.
1- Start every new week with the ‘Easy’ mode and work your way up through ‘Normal’ and then ‘Hard’ as you get better.
2- Listen and get to know the soundtrack.
3- In week two, there’s a part of Spookeez that might be difficult to get past. Focus on mastering the red arrows in that specific part.
4- To improve your hand position, try to use your left hand on L and UP and your right hand on R and DOWN.
5- You can play PaRappa the Rapper or other rhythm games as additional practice.

content2.text: Before you get started, here's a list of our rules. It is important that you read and understand them before continuing on. We highly encourage users to edit, even if you aren't experienced. If you make a mistake, the staff or other users can help to rectify any problems. We all share a common goal of improving the wiki and making it an accurate source for all Friday Night Funkin' fans and newcomers.

1. Vandalism is strictly prohibited and will be banned on sight. Admins reserve the right to fully ban your IP address if you continuously vandalize. It is very likely that you will be banned indefinitely from the community without warning if you are caught vandalizing multiple pages.

2. Do not create blank pages with titles that are irrelevant to the game or those that are similar to already-existing pages. These will be deleted and users will be warned. If a user continues to make more or brings back any that were previously deleted, they will be banned.
3. Refrain from adding headcanons (personal interpretations of canon), major information without sources and double check before adding any information 'confirmed' by Ninjamuffin99.
4. Refrain from trolling on the wiki. You aren't as funny as you think you are.

5. Refrain from commenting and posting sexual/explicit jokes or content on the wiki. This includes inappropriate images, videos and sound files to the wiki's galleries. NSFW content is not acceptable and will be removed and the poster will face consequences.

6. Do not role-play on the wiki. This isn't the place for that and we encourage you to go look elsewhere. We also ask that you refrain from ship discussions (character pairings) on the wiki as well due to the likelihood of harassment and fights spurring from such topics. If users are caught in an argument over them, all parties involved could face a temporary ban.

7. We absolutely do not tolerate homophobia, transphobia, racism, sexism or any kind of harassment on this wiki for any reason. Even as a 'joke', that kind of behavior is unacceptable and you could face serious consequences.

8. The wiki staff will try to resolve disputes to the best of our ability, take suggestions when editing protected pages, ban users that are acting inappropriately, delete irrelevant pages and more. If there is ever an issue within the wiki or the forums, it is best to contact an admin.

9. Do not request for admin rights. Not only is it rude, it makes the existing wiki staff less trusting of your abilities, especially if you have done very little to actually prove yourself as a respectable editor/contributor of the wiki.

10. Do not false report comments and posts. In most cases, anything reported that does not break the rules or violates the guidelines in the staff's eyes will not have any actions taken against it. Continuous false reporting may result in a warning and any further false reports could result in a temporary ban.
11. Do not spam. It's annoying and can clutter a discussion or disrupt wiki activity. Anyone who continues to spam on the wiki or forums may get banned.

12. Swearing is generally ok on the wiki and forums. However, be mindful of others and avoid it if you can. Excessive swearing may result in your comments being removed. No matter who you are, the use of derogatory slurs are completely unacceptable and will result in serious consequences on top of being removed.

13. Don't try to work around any of the rules, a.k.a. gaming the system. Bending them, finding a loop hole or manipulating definitions within the words written in an attempt to avoid punishment will not be tolerated at all. There is no justification for actions deemed offendable by the staff by reading in between the lines or saying that what you are being punished for wasn't explicitly written down. If you are caught engaging in bad behavior, you will face consequences, regardless of whatever elaborate excuses you come up with.

15. Admins can dictate how long a user is banned for. IP bans are usually indefinite to keep vandals away. Appeals are granted with very limited exceptions. Do not argue or challenge the admins over your punishment. The staff makes an effort to remain fair in our judgement in all cases, but you could make things worse for yourself if you continue acting immaturely, irrationally or try to escalate the situation.
